name: py-scanpy

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-wheel
dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-flit-core
dependencies.description: Distribution-building parts of Flit.

dependencies.name: py-importlib-metadata
dependencies.description: Read metadata from Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-tomli
dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-anndata
dependencies.description:
anndata is a Python package for handling annotated data matrices in
memory and on disk, positioned between pandas and xarray.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-seaborn
dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-tqdm
dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter

dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn
dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependencies.name: py-statsmodels
dependencies.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependencies.name: py-patsy
dependencies.description:
A Python package for describing statistical models and for building
design matrices.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-natsort
dependencies.description: Simple yet flexible natural sorting in Python.

dependencies.name: py-joblib
dependencies.description: Lightweight pipelining with Python functions.

dependencies.name: py-numba
dependencies.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM

dependencies.name: py-umap-learn
dependencies.description:
Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension
reduction technique that can be used for visualisation similarly to
t-SNE, but also for general non-linear dimension reduction.

dependencies.name: py-session-info
dependencies.description:
session_info outputs version information for modules loaded in the
current session, Python, and the OS.

dependent_to.name: py-kb-python
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper around kallisto | bustools for scRNA-seq analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-pathml
dependent_to.description: An open-source toolkit for computational pathology and machine learning.
